metadata.title: CVE-2021-47106 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: fix use-after-free in nft_set_catchall_destroy()We need to use list_for_each_entry_safe() iteratorbecause we can not access @catchall after kfree_rcu() call.syzbot reported:BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in nft_set_catchall_destroynet/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:4486 [inline]BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in nft_set_destroynet/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:4504 [inline]BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in nft_set_destroy+0x3fd/0x4f0net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:4493Read of size 8 at addr ffff8880716e5b80 by task syz-executor.3/8871CPU: 1 PID: 8871 Comm: syz-executor.3 Not tainted 5.16.0-rc5-syzkaller #0Hardware name: Google Google Compute Engine/Google Compute Engine, BIOSGoogle criterions.comment: linux package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-starfive package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
